title: Non-Christian faith leaders will play active role in King Charles III coronation service for first time
description: In a first, the royal event will feature a prominent role for Muslim, Hindu, Sikh, Buddhist and Jewish leaders, according to the order of service released by the office of Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby on Saturday.

title: Gunman on the run after five people shot dead in Texas
description: There have been more than 170 mass shootings – defined as four or more people wounded or killed – so far this year in the US, according to the Gun Violence Archive.

title: Thousands of Iran energy workers to be sacked, replaced, says official
description: Iran witnessed several waves of strikes by teachers and bus drivers in 2022 who protested low wages and high living costs.

title: Paraguay's presidential election puts the hegemony of the right to the test
description: In a country ravaged by corruption linked to drug trafficking, the outcome of the elections to be held on Sunday appears open. The right-wing Colorado Party has governed almost without interruption for 76 years.

title: Faced with an early heat wave and a major drought, Spain questions its water management
description: According to official data, 74% of the territory is at risk of desertification, with a significant or very high risk affecting 18% of the country.

title: Drought in Spain: 'If water management doesn't change, the country will become a desert'
description: With 80% of intake absorbed by agriculture, researcher Salvador Sanchez-Carillo warns against the overexploitation of water resources.

title: Thousands protest against French government's migration plans
description: Protesters took aim at Operation Wuambushi (Take Back) being carried out by the authorities on the French Indian Ocean Island of Mayotte to send back illegal immigrants, most from neighboring Comoros, currently housed in unsanitary shanty towns.

title: Armed robbers hit Paris Bulgari jewelry store
description: The raid comes after the same Bulgari store was targeted in an armed robbery in 2021.

title: England beat France 38-33 to win Women's Six Nations Grand Slam
description: France hit back after the break with 33 points, but the Red Roses came out on top after dominating the opening 40 minutes.

title: Pension reform: Macron, accused of 'contempt,' tries to drown out France's anger
description: Both the president and the government have been unable to dodge the noisy protests disrupting ministerial visits throughout France.

title: War in Ukraine: Huge fire at Crimea fuel depot after drone strike
description: Local authorities say a drone attack caused a huge fire, of  'around 1,000 square meters,' at a fuel depot in Crimea on Saturday.

title: Sudan fighting enters third week as UN says country collapsing
description: The World Food Programme has said the violence could plunge millions more into hunger in a country where one-third of the population already need aid to stave off famine.

title: Turkey's Erdogan returns from three-day campaign absence after illness
description: After suffering from a stomach infection, the Turkish president appeared at an aviation festival in Istanbul on Saturday.

title: The pseudo retirement of the very pious Vincent Bolloré
description: In theory, the French billionaire has left the management of his group to his two sons. In practice, he continues to manage everything, including the media. At 71, this very Catholic captain of industry feels invested in a mission.

title: Ocean Viking rescue ship saves 153 migrants off Malta
description: The 153 people saved had gone without food and water for two days, according to the French charity.

title: France vows economic reforms to continue after debt downgrade
description: France's finance minister dismissed concerns about the government's direction after the Fitch rating agency downgraded France to 'AA-'.

title: Fitch agency downgrades France to 'AA-' over 'social and political pressures'
description: One of the four main rating agencies responsible for assessing the creditworthiness of France said political deadlock and social unrest posed 'a risk to Macron's reform program.'

title: Biden to meet 18 Pacific leaders in Papua New Guinea
description: A US special envoy said that the United States was playing 'catch-up' after years of relative neglect that saw China's influence soar across the South Pacific.

title: How Viktor Orban went from being an 'agnostic liberal' to a defender of Christian values
description: Pope Francis is visiting Hungary this weekend. The country's prime minister is a declared champion of Europe's 'Christian values' despite his ambiguous attitude toward religions.

title: PSG, feuding with city of Paris, threatens move to Stade de France
description: Paris Saint-Germain wants to buy the Parc des Princes, the team's historic home, but the city, which owns the stadium, does not want to sell. The club's Qatari owners have made an offer to buy the Stade de France, in neighboring Saint-Denis.

title: Brazil: Lula recognizes six new Indigenous reserves
description: The Brazilian head of state declared that the registration of these reserves is part of his plan to 'achieve zero deforestation by 2030.'

title: Shares of US Bank First Republic plummet as bank faces uncertain future
description: First Republic quickly moved into focus on Wall Street's list of worries after the early March failures of Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank sparked fear of contagion.

title: Putin threatens to deport Ukrainians from regions annexed by Russia
description: Vladimir Putin signed a decree that would deport inhabitants of the Donetsk, Luhansk, Zaporizhzhia, Kherson and Crimean regions who do not accept Russian citizenship by July 1, 2024.

title: Why some Mayotte residents want shantytowns demolished: 'This is not racism; it is political conviction'
description: Seeing Comorians as a threat to their security, elected officials and residents of the archipelago defend the evictions and bulldozing of shantytowns.

title: In Hungary, Pope Francis admonishes Europe for their management of the war in Ukraine
description: Before an audience including Prime Minister Viktor Orbán, the pope deplored the fact that international politics 'is regressing to a kind of adolescent belligerence.'

title: BBC Chair Richard Sharp resigns over conflict of interest scandal involving Boris Johnson
description: Richard Sharp helped facilitate a personal loan to the former British prime minister, who then appointed him to the top job at the BBC. Sharp never disclosed his role in the loan.
